original: Bergstrand, Gustav Fredrik Wilhelm, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 13/10/73 i Värnhem, Skarab. 1., av kyrkoh. Carl B. o. Matilda Eriksson. G. 13 m. Svea Lindberg. Barn i Karin f. 15, Inge 17. — Studiex. i Skara 92, fil. kand. i Upps. 95, provår 97-98. Res. t. Tyskl. 96, 00, 04 o. m. stip. 27, Schweiz 03, Engl. 01 o. m. statsstip. 08.^ Förest, f. ensk. lärov. 98-99, vik. adj. i Skara 00, vik. adj. i Jönköp. 00-06, e. lär. i Skara 06-07, adj. i Sunds- vall 06, adj. i ty^ska o. eng. v. Gbgs ö. realsk. fr. 17 t. pens. E. lär. v. Gbgs navig:sk. 19. RVO 28.
translated: Bergstrand, Gustav Fredrik Wilhelm, secondary school teacher, Gothenburg, b. 13/10/73 in Värnhem, Skaraborg County, first child of the vicar Carl B. and Matilda Eriksson. Married to Svea Lindberg in 19xx and has two children, Karin b. 15 and Inge b. 17. Completed studies in Skara in 1892, received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Uppsala in 1895, and completed a probationary year from 1897-98. Traveled to Germany in 1896, 1900, 1904 and was granted a scholarship to Switzerland in 1903, and to England in 1901. Received a state scholarship in 1908. Was headmaster of a private school from 1898-99, substitute teacher in Skara in 1900, substitute teacher in Jönköping from 1900-06, permanent teacher in Skara from 1906-07, teacher of German and English at Gothenburg's east high school from 1917 until retirement. Was also a teacher at Gothenburg's navigation school from 1919. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1928.
